title: MAG 168 - Roots Transcript-converted
text:
The Magnus Archives – MAG 168 – Roots 
1 
MAG 168 — Roots 
Content Warnings 
• Death & mortality 
• Hypochondria 
• Potential medical neglect 
• Cancer 
• Convulsions 
• Stabbing 
• Falling 
 
[The Magnus Archives Theme – Intro] 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Rusty Quill presents... The Magnus Archives. Episode one hundred and sixty-
eight: "Roots." 
[Theme finishes] 
[Tape clicks on] 
[Faint overlapping whispers, like running water; every so often a 
wooden creak] 
[Gritty foot scuffs as Martin stands, agitated, by the Archivist] 
(A determined sigh from the Archivist) 
ARCHIVIST 
Okay! Time you went for a walk. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 168 – Roots 
2 
MARTIN 
Yeah, about that... You sure you'll be okay on your own? 
ARCHIVIST 
Um, I always have been. 
MARTIN 
Okay. I mean, well, I don't like this place. 
ARCHIVIST 
Once again Martin, that's… sort of the point! (small laugh) 
MARTIN 
Yeah, yeah, I know, alright; I get it; it's just— it's more than that. This place, 
what did you call it, the… (fumbling) the Rotten Core? 
ARCHIVIST 
The Corpse Roots. 
MARTIN 
Yeah, yeah, that. Well, it, it feels… I don't know, it feels like it's— 
ARCHIVIST 
Waiting. 
MARTIN 
Yeah! Waiting. 
[A pointed wood creak] 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 168 – Roots 
3 
(Beat) 
MARTIN (CONT'D) 
This is the one with the, um, the death guy, isn't it? 
ARCHIVIST 
This is Oliver Banks' domain, yes. 
MARTIN 
…So it's him that's waiting. 
ARCHIVIST 
Not just him, but… Yes. 
MARTIN 
So, are you gonna smite him, then? 
ARCHIVIST 
...Um.... 
MARTIN 
John? 
(The Archivist sighs softly) 
MARTIN (CONT'D) 
John, I said are you going to s— 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 168 – Roots 
4 
ARCHIVIST 
I heard you the first time. 
MARTIN 
And? 
ARCHIVIST 
I, I don't know. 
MARTIN 
Why not? Can't you just do what you did with that Sasha-thing, make the Eye 
see him and all that? 
ARCHIVIST 
I... could, I think. 
MARTIN 
Cool, so what's the problem, then? Take another monster off the hit list, job 
done. 
ARCHIVIST 
It's not, that simple? 
MARTIN 
Well, what does that mean. 
(Insistent) What does that mean, John? What, what happened to Kill Bill? 
John? John, you said— 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 168 – Roots 
5 
ARCHIVIST 
I know what I said, and I don't… (sigh) I don't know, Martin. I just, I don't think 
he's— I don't know; I don't think he's evil. 
MARTIN 
(Sarcastic) Oh, yeah, sure; he's probably a really kind, benevolent ruler of a 
hellish fear prison. 
ARCHIVIST 
It's just— he helped me. Wh-when I was… 
He woke me up. 
MARTIN 
(Flat, derisive) Wow. What a hero. 
ARCHIVIST 
Martin? 
MARTIN 
What. 
(The Archivist makes an amused breath) 
What. 
(Beat) 
Yeah, alright; I know; I'm sorry. 
ARCHIVIST 
(Amused) Is there something you want to talk about? 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 168 – Roots 
6 
MARTIN 
No, I'm, fine; it's fine; everything's fine! I'm sorry. 
ARCHIVIST 
(Smug) …Martin… 
MARTIN 
I said it's fine. 
ARCHIVIST 
(Smug) Are you jealous? 
MARTIN 
I told you not to know things about me! 
ARCHIVIST 
(Laughing) I really didn't have to. 
MARTIN 
I, Y-you— good. 'Cause I'm definitely not. 
ARCHIVIST 
Alright! 
MARTIN 
Look, I'm fine, alright? 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 168 – Roots 
7 
ARCHIVIST 
You said. 
MARTIN 
(Defensive) Yes, I did! And e- and even if I was jealous, I would be perfectly 
justified anyway, so! 
ARCHIVIST 
But you're not. 
MARTIN 
No! I'm fine. 
ARCHIVIST 
Alright! 
MARTIN 
Good! 
ARCHIVIST 
Good! 
MARTIN 
Great. 
(Beat) 
Alright, fine, yes, yes, I am jealous, alright? Yes, if you absolutely must know. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 168 – Roots 
8 
ARCHIVIST 
Because, he woke me up. 
(Martin makes a couple of sounds of disbelief) 
MARTIN 
I was there weeks, and nothing. He talks to you for five minutes and suddenly 
you're back on your feet and, bouncing around like a, like a spring chicken! 
ARCHIVIST 
(Laughing) I mean, that's really not— 
MARTIN 
I mean, what's so special about him, that you wake up for him and not me, 
hm? Enlighten me. 
ARCHIVIST 
I mean, that's… that's not really how it worked. It-It wasn't— 
Look. Martin, I'm sorry you feel that way, but I'm not going to kill a man just 
because you're jealous. 
MARTIN 
Why not?! 
(Beat) 
Yeah. Yeah, I know, I know, I know. (small sigh) 
(Beat) 
Please?
